title: Continue vs Goose by Block: Which code ai Tool is Better in 2026?
metaDescription: Compare Continue vs Goose by Block. See pricing, features, pros & cons to choose the best code ai tool for your needs in 2026.
introduction: Choosing between Continue and Goose by Block for your code ai needs? Both are popular tools in the AI space, but they have different strengths, pricing models, and use cases. This comprehensive comparison breaks down the key differences to help you make an informed decision.

sections.title: Overview: Continue vs Goose by Block
paragraphs: Continue is Continue is an open-source AI code assistant that brings the power of ChatGPT, Claude, and other LLMs directly into VS Code and JetBrains IDEs. It offers inline code generation, codebase-aware chat, and the ability to use any LLM provider or self-hosted model. Its key differentiator is complete customization - you control which model to use, what context to send, and how the AI interacts with your code, all while keeping your setup portable and vendor-neutral.. It's known for open-source, code-assistant, llm.

Goose by Block, on the other hand, is Goose is Block's open-source AI coding agent that runs entirely on your local machine, prioritizing privacy and control. Unlike cloud-based coding assistants, Goose processes all code locally using models like Claude, GPT-4, or self-hosted LLMs. It can read your codebase, execute commands, make changes, and learn from your feedback - all while keeping your code private. Its key differentiator is complete data sovereignty and the ability to work offline.. Users choose it for open-source, local-ai, privacy.

sections.title: Pricing Comparison
paragraphs: When it comes to value for money, consider your specific use case and team size. Continue offers a free tier, making it great for getting started. Goose by Block also has a free option for small teams or individuals.

sections.title: Features & Capabilities
paragraphs: Continue excels in: Support for multiple LLM providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, local models), Inline code generation and refactoring suggestions, Codebase-aware chat with context from your project. This makes it ideal for teams that need open-source.

Goose by Block stands out with: 100% local code processing with no data sent to cloud, Support for Claude, GPT-4, or self-hosted open-source models, Autonomous codebase exploration and modification. It's particularly strong for users focused on open-source.

sections.title: Use Cases: When to Choose Each Tool
paragraphs: Choose Continue if: You need open-source, work with code-assistant, or require flexible pricing.
Choose Goose by Block if: You prioritize open-source, work in local-ai, or prefer a free tier to start.

sections.title: Pros & Cons
paragraphs: Continue Pros: Verified platform, Highly rated (4.6/5), Extensive feature set.
Continue Cons: Some limitations on free tier.
Goose by Block Pros: Verified platform, Highly rated (4.5/5), Comprehensive features.
Goose by Block Cons: May have feature limitations.

verdict: Both Continue and Goose by Block are solid choices for code ai. Your choice depends on your specific requirements: Continue is better for open-source, while Goose by Block excels at open-source. Consider trying both with their free tiers or trials to see which fits your workflow better.
